comments.body:
```suggestion
    const result = {};
```

You may want to run `prettier` over all of this:

```
nix-shell -p nodePackages.prettier --run 'prettier --write ledger/metrics/collection/summary.js'
```
I personally prefer `for (row of rawData)`, but I'm good either way.
At the very least, I'd recommend using `Promise.all` to speed things up.
Perhaps add a `#!/usr/bin/env node` above this and make it executable?

comments.body: It'd be nice to have a `flatMap`, right? It's in node.js v12 (as is `flat`), but unfortunately we can't use it here unless we upgrade.

Yes, this block is copy pasted from the alternative implementation of `flatMap` from [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/flatMap) ðŸ˜„ 

Same for the local method `fetch` - it would be nice to use `node-fetch`, but I did not want to add npm dependencies.
